review: This is one of those electronic gizmos that you get and you hook it up exactly like the directions say and it doesn't work. So you think, "Hmmmm I must not have been paying attention." So you try it again and it doesn't work. After 30 minutes trying to hook it up using my laptop, I gave up.Then I got my iPhone out and it hooked up fine the 1st time. After it was hooked up there were only 2 apps I could run. Netflix and YouTube.  I already have those on my TV anyway and they run better from the TV. Netflix was a compressed picture and I couldn't get the sound to work and the same with YouTube.Summary, I will never use this. I will however plug it in from time to time to see if there are updates. Save your money.
author: Scott Taft

author: Alex

review: Works as advertised, and I've used it to stream content from my computer.  With most TVs being 'smart TVs', this product may not be for everyone.  I've hooked it up to an older HDTV set and it looks a lot better than the standalone media player box, plus it doesn't need a separate plug to add to the clutter (as long as there's an available USB port nearby).  I gave it 4 stars since the design means one should think about where the HDMI port is on the TV.  If you only have a side HDMI port available the product will be visible sticking out from the side (not the cleanest of looks).  If your HDMI ports in the back are oriented that it would plug in horizontally instead of vertically, you would need to make sure there's enough clearance for the chromecast to reside (may be an issue for those mounting their TV on the wall).  Additionally, the fact you need a USB port to power it is another consideration since older TVs may lack one.  I hope the functionality continues to expand on this unit, as I've seen (and bought into) a lot of products that work great off the bat, but fizzle once support wanes.
